text: I come from Nigeria I grew up on a farm
in North Carolina I've been born and
brought up in India I studied industrial
engineering in Lima I moved to Paris to
study uh business and finance at the
University of sbon before HBS I had
worked at GE for 4 years I spent 2 years
with Teach for America I taught in the
South Bronx I served for about 5 years
in the Marine Corps I was a platoon
Commander coming into HBS I knew that I
wanted to run a television that work I
came in knowing I wanted to be a leader
and knowing I wanted to make an
impact please anyone I chose Harvard
Business School for a number of reasons
but one of the largest ones was the case
method the cases often deal with
cultural sensitivities which you engage
with 90 people you learn from their
experiences they learn from yours and so
we're actually putting oursel in the
shoes of the chief executive office
officer of the chief marketing officer
or sometimes just the manager on the
ground in in very difficult situations
Harvard Business School uh had this
reputation of developing leaders that
make a difference in the world I wanted
to be to learn to be such a leader one
day HBS really challenges students to be
introspective about their career choices
I have a passion for clean energy I have
a passion for combining soer and
education I have a very strong passion
for entrepreneurship I'm really
passionate about International branding
for consumers we have artists here we
have DJs we have dancers professional
athletes you name
it there is a belief on campus that if
you follow your heart and pursue your
passions you can accomplish great things
after I graduate I'll be joining the
largest Renewable Energy company in
Australia after graduation I'm going to
take a consulting job in Mexico City I
will be working on the Lincoln Center
strategy planning team including digital
strategy marketing education once I
graduated I'll be working in mayor Tom
mono's office the mayor of Boston and
I'll be helping him think about how to
implement education and economic
development policies I feel like I can
take the leadership lessons I learned in
the Marine Corps and apply them in the
private sector and I don't think I would
have been able to do that as well
without the education and experience
that HBS has given me when I hear the
dean talk about hbs's mission of
creating leaders who make a difference
in the world I feel both challenged um
and inspired by by that mission and I
think that's something that most HBS
students
share
